meanings.sent1: The car horn was blatting loudly in the traffic.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm was blatting outside the window.
meanings.sent3: The alarm clock kept blatting until I finally woke up.
meanings.sent4: The wind was blatting through the trees like a wild beast.
meanings.sent5: The firecrackers were blatting in the distance, startling everyone.

meanings.sent1: The baby was blatting for attention in the crib.
meanings.sent2: The lost lamb was blatting for its mother in the field.
meanings.sent3: The cat was blatting at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The actor on stage was blatting out his lines with emotion.
meanings.sent5: The child was blatting with joy when she saw her birthday present.

meanings.definition: To play a musical instrument loudly and harshly.
meanings.sent1: The beginner was blatting on the trumpet during practice.
meanings.sent2: The drummer was blatting on the drums during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The student was blatting on the piano keys, trying to learn a new song.
meanings.sent4: The guitarist was blatting on the strings, creating a unique sound.
meanings.sent5: The band was blatting together, creating a cacophony of music.
